{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3739528,"name":"Chad (Team5046)","username":"IceStorm","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/76d3ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-15T00:24:23.727Z","cooked":"

We’re looking to replace our current swerve drive (MaxSwerve) and trying to compare the WCP X2i with the SDS Mk5i.

Based on what I’m seeing they are very similar but wanted to get the weigh in from other teams on why they would go WCP over SDS or vice-versa. One thing I like about the X2i is that I can get it now and we can start playing with it pre-season vs the Mk5i waiting until possibly December (or longer) before we have it.

Our plan is to move from the Neo and Neo 550’s over to the Kraken X60’s for both drive and steer.

Any advice or input is appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-15T00:24:23.727Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":259,"readers_count":258,"score":96.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506298,"topic_slug":"swerve-comparision-2025-2026","display_username":"Chad (Team5046)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11871,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-comparision-2025-2026/506298/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3739555,"name":"Ira Pino","username":"ip6059","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/958977/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-15T01:25:44.750Z","cooked":"

I would say just buy what’s available now– in terms of robot competitiveness, there isn’t really all that much difference between different swerve modules so long as they’re sufficiently mechanically robust. You may also want to consider asking another team near you if they have any old module sets laying around; this can often be significantly cheaper, although it does mean taking a little more attention to detail in purchasing things which tend to degrade with time (bearings, tread, certain gears, etc). We actually ended up refurbishing modules from 2022 this year (WCP Swerve X Flipped) and had no issues with the modules themselves– just make sure to buy new bearings, aluminum gears, belts, etc if you do go this route.
Having the extra time to set up swerve (although given that you’re using Krakens and can use the CTRE swerve generator that’s less of a factor) will also be nice compared to having to do it in-season.

We have swerve today using the REV MaxSwerve product line so don’t need used modules. Were just finding that the MaxSwerve isn’t as widely used and honestly seems to be lacking in a lot of ways to the SDS and WCP product lines. We also want to get over to using more CTRE rather than REV as more teams seem to be using them and the example code (as well as the Swerve generator in Phoenix) appears more regularly.

I’m really just trying to see what the bulk of teams are using these days and if it’s really worth waiting until Dec on the SDS vs now for WCP.

We’ve found the problem with sds IS availability. We moved away from them because we waited months for the geaes we needed for the proper ratios. They just don’t seem to have the bandwidth WCP does. Or they just don’t keep the same inventory level.

All of the X2 modules from WCP are great. We ran X2t modules last season with Krakens, X60s for drive and X44s for steering. It’s a good motor pair and works on the WCP modules with no modification.
